title: Rome IV Diagnostic Criteria for Infant Regurgitation
desc: The Rome IV Criteria for Infant Regurgitation provides criteria for the diagnosis of infant regurgitation.

orgreference.text: Benninga MA, Faure C, Hyman PE, St james roberts I, Schechter NL, Nurko S. Childhood Functional Gastrointestinal Disorders: Neonate/Toddler. Gastroenterology. 2016; 1443-1455.

Rosen R, Vandenplas Y, Singendonk M, Cabana M, DiLorenzo C, Gottrand F, Gupta S, Langendam M, Staiano A, Thapar N, Tipnis N, Tabbers M. J Pediatr Gastroenterol Nutr. 2018 Mar;66(3):516-554.

data.evidence:
To fulfill the Rome IV criteria for infant regurgitation, patient must be an otherwise healthy infant 3 weeks to 12 months of age and have the following:

  1. Regurgitation ≥2 times per day for ≥3 weeks.
  2. No retching, hematemesis, aspiration, apnea, failure to thrive, feeding or swallowing difficulties, or abnormal posturing.
